intro: Anplectrum biligulatum, commonly known as the two-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish-green cyathia, which are the specialized inflorescences typical of the spurge family. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy soils. Anplectrum biligulatum is a perennial herb that can reach a height of up to 30 centimeters.
